fields.description:
I am able to attach different files using the same name to a CEO through AttachmentManager.setAttachmentData(Attachment attachment, InputStream attachmentData), and they will end up with different IDs.

A similar situation can be created by uploading 2 files with different filenames and then edit one of the attachments to have the same name as the other (so both are now called the same). This can be replicated on a UI level as well as through the API. I believe there were issues with separating them one they are together too.

This means that I can no longer get to one of the files either through the UI (as it links to the filename) or via the API as the method signature is Attachment getAttachment(ContentEntityObject content, String attachmentFileName, int version) or Attachment getAttachment(ContentEntityObject content, String attachmentFileName).

For me the ideal solution would be to able to both get the Attachment by id, and to have the UI maintain integrity through throwing exceptions or creating a new version of the same file (I have no preference there).
fields.summary: Unable to access attachments on a CEO by ID

fields.description: We've been using the Code macro to document much of our SQL code.  The code macro doesn't highlight comments. The only part of the code that gets highlighted in a different color are the keywords (SELECT, FROM, WHERE).  The code is very hard to read without comments highlights. Please fix the macro to correctly highlight SQL comments in some color (ie green).
fields.summary: SQL Syntax Highlighting in Code Macro

fields.description:
We are trying to evaluate this software for deployment but we have about 1000 various attachments in it so and indexing has not ran since.
It gets about to about 80% in 20 minutes but stops all together around 98%. Is it an issue with the fact that we still have it using the embedded database? Our actual production will be websphere with either Oracle 10g or DB2. Is there a macro that will list what the real names of the files are in the queue? Is there a marco/tool that will tell me what is currently beig indexed as well as the next several items waiting during a reinde?.
fields.summary: indexing not finishing - hanging after more than 24 hours

fields.description:
As us being a research university it would be very helpful, if our employed staff (and students) could work together on international research projects within Confluence.  That requires external users having user-level access to our Confluence installation. External people having an account could currenty be done by either
* self-subscribing, or
* managing external users in our universities LDAP server.

Activating self-subsription in Concluence means, anyone in the world can be a member of our enterprises' communication system, which is not acceptable. Managing external users in LDAP is also not a viable way.

Instead, it would be a GOOD THING to have, if members of the organization would be enabled to explicitly invite other non-organization people to Confluence.  Those new members would receive an invitation email with a link to approve the membership, and only those invited people would become members of the Confluence installation. 

In addition, it would be required for the new account to follow a (configurable, e.g. by specifying a regular expression to match) user name pattern to not conflict with the delegated user database.

It could also be helpful, if this invitation right would be a dedicated right assignable by LDAP for a group of users, but probably not all.

A first implementation hint for a plugin comes from the Atlassian support (thanks guys!):

- an 'enter new invitation' XWork action with Web UI module, which...
- records the invitee's email address together with a secret value in Bandana, and...
- sends an email to the invitee with a link to...
- an 'accept invitation' XWork action, which...
- validates the secret value in the URL against Bandana, and...
- adds the new user to Confluence with details they provide. 

This is a feature common in other CMS and similar systems and would be a major improvement for Confluence, the Enterprise wiki.
fields.summary: Provide invitation of new users
Option for Hiding Children by Default

fields.description:
The Formatting Content page on the demonstration space which ships with Confluence contains the following sentence :

Confluence pages are written in a simple markup language based on Textile. By using this simple markup Confluence makes it easy for your team to creating and share content together.

should read:

Confluence pages are written in a simple markup language based on Textile. By using this simple markup Confluence makes it easy for your team to create and share content together.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                error ^
fields.summary: Formatting Content on Confluence demonstration space grammer mistake

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6890].
  {panel}

Bruce Krasnof reported this issue on the user list (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/mail/186932). Perhaps we can customise our Axis WSDL to use a non-deprecated encoding (?) and remove the duplicate method names.

-- 

We're trying out Eclipse with XFire libraries for web services.   I got an exception when using the XFire dynamic client with Confluence's remote soap api, I thought it was a bug in XFire but the developer of XFire says it's an issue with the wsdl file.  It's minor, just an fyi for other folks trying out XFire.  I think the problem is just the dynamic client approach, which maybe wasn't the best way anyways.
 
On 8/27/06, Dan Diephouse (JIRA) <jira@codehaus.org> wrote:
>
>      [ http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/XFIRE-599?page=all ]
>
> Dan Diephouse closed XFIRE-599.
> -------------------------------
>
>     Resolution: Won't Fix
>
> There are two problems with the confluence wsdl which make it non-basic
> profile conformant (see www.ws-i.org for more information about the Basic
> Profile - it is basically a standard which tells you how to build correct
> web services).
> 1. It uses RPC-Encoding which is deprecated
> 2. It has multiple operations with the same name, which isn't allowed in
> the basic profile.
>
> We may support these in the future, but I believe there are already issues
> for these.
fields.summary: Make remote API WSDL work with XFire dynamic client

fields.description:
Changing page permissions will update the last modifier of a page even though no content was changed. This makes it look like the changes were done by a different person. 

For example: 

- Bob makes changes to a page (resulting in version 2)
- Fred goes and changes the permissions of the page without changing the content
- History will show Fred as last editor (of version 2)
- The changes made between version 1 and version 2 appear as done by Fred and not by Bob anymore
fields.summary: Changing permissions on the page changes last modifier

fields.description:
If you try to access, for example, /confluence/doesnotexist.action, the correct result should be a 404 page.

However, Tomcat retrieves the exception which is set as a request attribute by WebWork when it can't find an action, and changes the response code from 404 to 500. This is then sent to the user as 500page.jsp.

This is a known issue in Webwork 2.1.3 which is used in Confluence 2.2.x:

https://issues.apache.org/struts/browse/WW-733
fields.summary: Missing action redirects to 500page.jsp on Tomcat

fields.description:
When using the WML editor, it is easy to create a link but just adding the bracket around the link.  It is very easy to do this and it is one of the strengths of wikis.   Unfortunately, doing the same thing in the WYSIWYG editor requires about four or five clicks and a copy and paste etc.     This is one of the few operations that is much slower in the WYSIWYG editor, but unfortunately I think it is one of the most critical.

Here are a couple of solutions:
    1) Add a new button to the WYSIWYG tool bar that does the job for us.   I would like to be able to hightlight a word or phrase and then just click on the 'quick link' button to make the hightlighted text turn in to a link.  A short cut key would be nice too.
    2) Modify the 'Link Properties' dialog box so  the highlighted text in the 'Link' field is prepopulated in the same was as the 'Alias' field.     Note it would be fantastic if the 'Search' field was prepopulated with the same text so I could see if the page already exists.   Creating a link to a page that unexpectedly exists is a special 'wiki moment' that puts a smile on people faces when they realise someone has already done their work before them!


I really think that this would improve the usage of the WYSIWYG enormously for a very small development cost.

Cheers,

James.
fields.summary: A way to improve WYSYWIG hyperlinking

fields.description:
The Scripting Macros plugin directs users to install two JARs for POI 3.0 in WEB-INF/lib. This clashes with POI 2.0 which is used by Confluence, and causes the error below.

We need to either get the Scripting Macros to bundle this dependency (easier), or update Confluence to use POI 3.0 (harder).

fields.description: When a page is moved, the attachments on that page are currently not re-indexed. Therefore the attachments will still appear under the attachment tab of the old space and not under the tab of the new space. This gives the impression that attachments were not moved to the other space.
fields.summary: Attachments are now re-index when page is moved

fields.description:
Currently I can add a web-item to system.page to add a new tab (e.g. Translate). I have have that web-item link to my action and have the velocity output contain the following:

#applyDecorator("root")
    #decoratorParam("helper" $action.helper)
    #decoratorParam("mode" "translate")
    #decoratorParam("context" "page")

The problem is that the page.vmd is hardwired to understand certain modes (view, edit, attachments, info) and it doesnt have a catch-all "else" to just dump the contents of $body out. It just drops the body out completely - a similar thing happens in the space.vmd too.

To make things worse, the "current" tab is selected based on matching $mode against the $item.key - so even if I surrender to rendering in page mode (and getting last edited by, favourites & comments - which I dont want) it means that the page tab will still be selected regardless!

The solution to this would be to take:

                    ## ATTACHMENTS
                    #elseif ($mode == "view-attachments" || $mode == "move-attachments")
                        $body
                    #end

and have 

                    ## ATTACHMENTS
                    #elseif ($mode == "view-attachments" || $mode == "move-attachments")
                        $body

                    ## CATCH ALL
                    #elseif 
                        $body
                    #end

Instead - do similar for space.vmd, but that needs both the $context and the various $mode if's in them having the catch all's applied. There may be other areas across the decorators which suffer the same limitation.

With this extension I can actually start to use web-item's for page and space tabs in plugins!
fields.summary: Page and Space decorators need a catch all mode for $context and $mode

fields.description:
Resume editing on a blog post goes to Page Not Found.

To replicate on 2.2.8:
1) Go to your personal space and click Add News.
2) Enter a title and some content, then click Preview.
3) Go to Browse Space, then to Add News.
4) In the "A new page you were adding" text, click Resume Editing ( http://localhost:8080/pages/createblogpost.action?spaceKey=~admin# )

This goes to the Page Not Found page ( http://localhost:8080/pages/createblogpost.action )
fields.summary: Cannot resume editing of news posts
Why do I need to enter a license when I am doing a restore?

fields.description: this is a feature that certain web based editors have implemented (gmail for example).  Basically, just want to execute a save when users use standard keyboard shortcuts.  Don't want to trigger the "Save as HTML" dialog...
fields.summary: Override browser keyboard shortcuts to act like a desktop app (ex: Ctrl-S should save page on Windows)
New code macro needs to be able to collapse from control bar

fields.description:
I had a space with permissions group A assigned to it.  I wanted to rename the group - but couldn't see how to do so, so I created a brand new group (B) and added all the same members. I then added this new group B to the space permissions, and also removed all the users from group A.  

Since I was no longer using group A, I removed it.  Now, when I go to click on the space, I get "You are not authorized to see this..."  When I go into Browse space > space admin > permissions, I get the below error.

Please Help!  How can I get the permissions back?

------

-----

fields.summary: After deleting group, space is unaccessible

fields.description: When a url is defined in the confluence page can we open it as soon as the confluence page is accessed. it should be a part af the confluence and should not require the user to click on the url
fields.summary: Need to know a marco which will open the url in confluence when the url is defined in the page

fields.description:
I have a {dynamictasklist} macro on a page with read only access for anonymous users.

1. The "Add" button and "del" links are displayed even though anonymous users can't edit the page.

2. When trying to add something, the login dialog is displayed but in a very wrong format.
fields.summary: {dynamictasklist} macro permissions/login problem

fields.description:
As a non-logged in user, point to the disabled "Add Page" icon. The tool tip text "$textSpaceNoAddPermission" is displayed.

Apparently some text mapping is missing.
fields.summary: wrong mouse tool tip text

fields.description:
when accessing a page which contains the {dynamictasklist} macro using a https URL, Microsoft Internet Explorer complains about unsecure objects on the page. 

The offending request is http:// .... /images/icons/wait.gif, it should actually be https:// .... /images/icons/wait.gif
fields.summary: hardcoded http request in {dynamictasklist} macro

fields.description:
This problem also occurs in Confluence 2.2.8 due to an incorrect version of the atlassian-user library being shipped. Please replace the existing atlassian-user.jar in WEB-INF/lib with the attached version.

--- 

Original description:

View groups for an LDAP user.  Both LDAP and non-LDAP groups are listed (nice!).  Only the non-LDAP groups can be added/removed (good).  Remove any or all of the non-LDAP groups.  UI shows the groups removed.  Go back to viewing the user.  Removed groups are back!!!  Repeat process, same result.  Same if I use remote API to remove the group.  I would appreciate a work around at least.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Cannot remove LDAP user from local confluence group

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new Confluence page
2. In the edit form, add the invalid label: 'del.icio.us'
3. Save the page

Expected outcome:

  The validation error for the labels should be visible

Actual outcome:

  The validation error for the labels is inside a hidden div, and only visible if you look for it. Otherwise there is no indication of why (or even if) the save failed.
fields.summary: Label validation errors hidden in edit page

fields.description: The Undefined Pages report in Browse Space -> Advanced is incorrect.  Currently the report will list links in text between {noformat} macro calls as an undefined link.  The Info tab of the page correctly determines that a link between {noformat}s is not a true link, and does not list this as an outgoing link.  In the Undefined Pages report for the space however, these links are reported as undefined pages.
fields.summary: Undefined Pages report in Browse Space -> Advanced is incorrect

fields.description:
Using the properties file, we are able to localize many sales links now in the JP release to point to www.atlassian.jp 

However, if the user switches language to English, the links fall back to .com even though it is a JP license for a Japanese customer.

It would be ideal if (a) either the links remain independent of the language user chooses, else (b) we need to change the links for the English as well (I suppose this can be done by editing the English properties file).

The way this issue is addressed in the JP release of JIRA is through the use of an external links file. More information here: CONF-6200

Please advise how you recommend to resolve this issue.
fields.summary: Allow sales links to remain localized even if user switches language

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6828].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian,

in the "Confluence Changes in the last 24 hours" mail, the usage of the
title of the changed documents causes sometimes link problems.
Maybe its better to use the tiny URL instead of the title for the link?

When the pages have been renamed since then, the link is (in most cases)
broken!  Some less advanced users sometimes create pages with title "New
Page" - believe it or not.  When the title is changed later on, the link
is broken, see below:

confluence@riege.com schrieb:
> >       This is a daily summary of all recent changes in Confluence.
[..]
> >     * [New Page] New Page </display/RSIDEV/New+Page> was created by
> >       X <https://wiki.riege.com/display/~X> - 11:23:08.
> >
> > Powered by Atlassian Confluence
> > <http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/default.jsp?clicked=footer>
> > (Version: 2.2.7 Build:#524 Jul 28, 2006) - Bug/feature request
> > <http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/BrowseProject.jspa?id=10470>

Best regards,
Heiko
fields.summary: Links problems in "Confluence Changes in the last 24 hours" mails when renaming newly created articles

fields.description: As described in the summary... the gallery field for the image is empty
fields.summary: Gallery macro cannot display animated GIFs
Line breaks in new code macro are removed when edited inside WYSIWYG editor

fields.description:
I found error in admin main screen when license ended.

I think you will fix this error. good luck~ :-)
fields.summary: Error on Admin main when license ended.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6824].
  {panel}

Critical information loss can occur too easily with attachments. As opposed to wiki pages (which are versioned and recoverable in case of deletion) important attachments can be lost by deletion when not protected by a restriction at the page level. Moreover, they cannot be recovered from the trash can.

Our company needs to trust Confluence with critical information in the form of attachments. Our users must be able to leave a page unrestricted while relying on Confluence that their attachments will not be deleted by mistake or by the action of another single user without any chance of recovering it. 

Confluence needs a special restriction/control over attachments. Currently, it leaves important documentation unprotected/unrecoverable in case of accidental deletion. 

The solution should include a default permission for deletion; a warning message when righfully deleting an attachment; and the ability to recover it from the trash can.
fields.summary: "Delete Attachment" Default Permission and Warning Needed

fields.description:
The {attachments} macro produces a list of attachments of a page/post.  That list can be sorted by clicking on the column header.

It is not possible to reverse-sort the list by a column, e.g. by clicking on the column header again.

Please provide a way to reverse-sort the list as produced by the {attachments} macro.
fields.summary: Allow reverse sorting of attachments

fields.description:
The {attachments} macro produces a list of attachments of a page/post.  That list can be sorted by clicking on the column header.

There appears to be no conceivable default sort order, hence the list of attachments looks unsorted upon initial view.

Please sort the list of attachments by a reasonable column upon first display, e.g. name.
fields.summary: Provide default sorting for attachments macro
Put Removed Attachments Into The Trash

fields.description: The temp directory in confluence-home is created as necessary, except  when doing a full reindex. In this case, every file generates an error about being unable to create a temporary file during the indexing.
fields.summary: Reindexing fails if temp directory doesn't exist

fields.description:
I previously reported a similar issue...
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6627 

After we upgraded from version 2.0 to 2.2.3, we noticed that a few of our user's profiles, which had more than one picture attached to them -- lost all but one picture. It seems it kept the profile picture but didn't carry over any other attachments. 

We need to recover these lost files.  In CONF-6627, Dave posted "If you want to recover the files that were attached to your user's profiles prior to the upgrade, you will find these in your Confluence home directory under old/<username>."

However I looked in the home directory under old/<username> and they do not appear as the individual files themselves. instead they appear as 1 and 2 (no extensions).  How can we recover these?
fields.summary: After upgrade to 2.2.3 - users lost all attachments in their user profiles. How to recover?

fields.description: I have installed the current version of Confluence and imported the XML backup which was created by the old installation of Confluence. After the import I invoked the feature for rebuilding the index because I was not able to search anymore. Unfortuantely the rebuild did not succeed. Instead the progress of the rebuild slowed down nearly exponentially and did not finish. After downgrading to 2.2.7 the import and index rebuild worked again without any problems.
fields.summary: Rebuild index not possible after upgrade from 2.1.5a to 2.2.8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6807].
  {panel}

Installing the JDK is currently the most difficult required step in setting up a Confluence evaluation. By upgrading the Apache Tomcat bundled with Confluence to 5.5.7e or later, users can run a Sun JRE instead of the JDK. 

Advantages:
1) Since many more users will already have a Sun JRE installed compared to a JDK, more users can skip the step entirely.
2) Downloading the JRE from java.com is a user-friendly 2 click process. The JDK download page is intended for developers and makes it hard for unfamiliar users to find the correct bundle. The JRE downloads in half the time (16 meg vs 50 meg).
fields.summary: Upgrade Standalone Tomcat so that JRE is required instead of JDK
Add instant messaging integration to Confluence (for logging IM conversations)

fields.description:
Info message when starting with Tomcat 5.5 indicates that using a natively compiled APR library instead of the generic one may result in performance increase. It looks worth checking out in case it is useful to recommend to Tomcat Apache users or even bundle in platform-specific Standalones. 

Message - "INFO: The Apache Tomcat Native library which allows optimal performance in production environments was not found on the java.library.path: (path here)"

APR library link is http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-5.5-doc/apr.html
fields.summary: Increase Standalone performance with platform-specific Apache Tomcat Portable Runtime Project library

fields.description:
BODYCONTENT.BODY is a blob column 2Gb, but DB2 only support 1Gb directly... for 2Gb you need to expecify NOT LOGGED.
I change hibernate-mapping to 1Gb and work correctly!


DB2 Explanation:

Large Object data types (BLOB, CLOB, and DBCLOB) may be created in sizes up to 2 gigabytes (2147483647 bytes). Logging of data values is allowed only upon objects which are less than or equal to than 1 gigabyte (1073741823 bytes) in size. Therefore, large objects greater than 1 gigabyte in size can not be logged.
User response:

Either explicitly indicate logging of data is not required, by using the NOT LOGGED phrase during column creation, or reduce the maximum size of the column to 1 gigabyte or below.

sqlcode: -355

sqlstate: 42993
fields.summary: DB2 not support 2Gb BLOB Column
Let insert link search dialog find blog posts

this value is deprecated value.

http://www.w3.org/QA/2002/04/valid-dtd-list.html

fields.description:
Running it results in this exception: 

When I performed the first step of the test described in this link: 

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Troubleshooting+Character+Encodings 

I get the following error stack: 

 Cause: 
java.sql.SQLException: Argument data type text is invalid for argument 1 of lower function. 

Stack Trace: [hide] 

java.sql.SQLException: Argument data type text is invalid for argument 1 of lower function. 
at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SQLDiagnostic.addDiagnostic(SQLDiagnostic.java:365) 
at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.tdsErrorToken(TdsCore.java:2781) 
at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.nextToken(TdsCore.java:2224) 
at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.getMoreResults(TdsCore.java:628) 
at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.executeSQLQuery(JtdsStatement.java:418) 
at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsPreparedStatement.executeQuery(JtdsPreparedStatement.java:693) 
at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyPreparedStatement.executeQuery(NewProxyPreparedStatement.java:75) 
at com.atlassian.confluence.admin.actions.debug.EncodingTestAction.retrieveLowerDatabaseTestString(EncodingTestAction.java:106) 
at com.atlassian.confluence.admin.actions.debug.EncodingTestAction.execute(EncodingTestAction.java:64) 
at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:168) 
at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35) 
at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165) 
at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.DefaultWorkflowInterceptor.intercept(DefaultWorkflowInterceptor.java:55) 
at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceWorkflowInterceptor.intercept(ConfluenceWorkflowInterceptor.java:39) 

This is because the LOWER function in MS SQL can only be performed on fields that can be converted into a varchar (the BODYCONTENT.BODY column that the encoding test is trying to lower is a TEXT or clob-equivalent field in MS SQL). 

See: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/tsqlref/ts_la-lz_1pki.asp
fields.summary: Encoding test incompatible with MS SQL Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6795].
  {panel}

If a space admin restricts pages to a single user or group, that page is not displayed to confluence-adminstrators or space admins when browsing a space.  If all users or groups with view access are later removed, the page cannot be found by any users at all unless the admin decides to check the restricted pages option in security. Confluence administrators can view/edit the page directly, but the pages are not displayed in recently updated or view pages.

If a space admin decides to create a private page, that page can be hidden from confluence-administrators. If the user is later deleted from the system, their pages will just float around unless an admin periodically checks for restricted pages in spaces

It is more intuitive that Confluence adminis have all rights to all spaces and pages automatically, and space admins have all rights to all pages in that space.

To create an invisible page:
1) Create a new user with space admin rights
2) As the new user, create a page and restrict all rights to just yourself
3) Admins cannot find out that the page exists

Workaround: If you know the title of a page, an administrator can view it directly and open the page permissions as long as confluence-administrators still has space admin rights.
fields.summary: Pages can be made invisible to admins or all users except in Restricted Pages

fields.description:
The current parameters for the panel macro include:

title: Title of the panel 
borderStyle: The style of the border this panel uses (solid, dashed and other valid CSS border styles) 
borderColor: The color of the border this panel uses 
borderWidth: The width of the border this panel uses 
bgColor: The background color of this panel 
titleBGColor: The background color of the title section of this panel

Can you add a titleColor? This will allow us to use dark backgrounds and set the text to white.

Thanks
fields.summary: Add titleColor to panel macro

fields.description:
I have not confirmed that this bug still exists on the latest version of Confluence, but I have found that when you convert a space to a Personal Space, the links to pages are updated correctly but links to news items are not.

My original links were:

[tsfsdf|AA:/2006/08/16/Test News]
[tsfsdf|AA:Test Page]

And during the Convert to Personal Space process, this was converted to:

[tsfsdf|AA:/2006/08/16/Test News]
[tsfsdf|~admin:Test Page]

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 3rd November, 2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,
After some discussion we have come to the conclusion that we will not be implementing this bug fix. We are looking at deprecating the "convert to personal space" feature for 4.0 as there is not much customer demand for this.We can't see ourselves completing this fix in the foreseeable future and don't have plans to in our backlog. I'll be marking this issue as "Won't Fix".

We also [have partners that can help you customise Confluence|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APW/] that could help you with a one-off/ad-hoc custom work if needed.
Sherif Mansour
Confluence Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Convert to Personal Space does not update News Item links
Include link information in printed versions of pages
